conclusion: Determine the maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side.
Car A moves at a constant speed of 40 m/s from t = 0 to t = 20 seconds and is at rest from t = 20 to t = 30 seconds.
Position function for Car A: x_A(t) = 40t for 0 ≤ t ≤ 20 seconds; x_A(t) = 800 m for 20 < t ≤ 30 seconds.
Car B starts from rest and accelerates linearly with a slope of 2 m/s².
Velocity function for Car B: v_B(t) = 2t.
Position function for Car B: x_B(t) = t^2.
Position of Car A at t = 30 seconds is x_A(30) = 800 m.
Position of Car B at t = 30 seconds is x_B(30) = 900 m.
Find time when Car A and Car B are side by side again after t = 30 seconds by setting x_B(t) = x_A(t).
Solve t^2 = 800 to find t = 20√2 s, approximately 28.28 s.
Calculate distance between Car A and Car B at t = 20 seconds: Distance = 800 - 400 = 400 m.
Calculate distance between Car A and Car B at t = 30 seconds: Distance = 900 - 800 = 100 m.
Calculate distance between Car A and Car B at t = 20√2 seconds: Distance = 800 - 800 = 0 m.
